transcript:
account, which he had ready in his mind, of all he knew and had seen. But the Emperor smiled and in- terrupted him. 
"How many miles?" 
"From where to where, Your Majesty?" 
"From Durrenstein to Krems." 
"Three and a half miles, Your Majesty." 
"The French have abandoned the left bank?" 
"According to the scouts the last of them crossed on rafts during the night." 
"Is there sufficient forage in Krems?" 
"Forage has not been supplied to the ex- tent . . ." 
The Emperor interrupted him.
